main event: On January 24, 1956 in Seattle, Washington, a civilian observed an oval-shaped, golden and glowing object with a long tail climbing in the sky for 3 minutes. The weather was clear at the time of the sighting.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 minutes and had an unusual appearance, described as oval-shaped, golden, and glowing with a long tail.
The observation was made by a civilian in clear weather, adding credibility to the sighting.
The object was initially climbing from south to north and was later estimated to be the size of a dime.
It was suggested that the object could have been a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature, but the limited data made a conclusive analysis difficult.
The sighting occurred at the same time a radiosonde was released at Sandpoint, with Venus at 35ยบ Washington, adding contextual information.
sighted object: Oval-shaped, golden and glowing object with a long tail
